Digital I/O

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

The attachment of the CameraLink CC signals and the digital I/O can be controlled by this feature. Check your camera vendor's manual which CC signals are required by your camera type and on which of the four CC ports the camera expects them.

Four input and two output signal generators are supported. The input can be read, the output is freely programmable.

The first generator is the signal image trigger. This signal can be freely set up in both period and exposure time (low phase). It is intended to trigger the camera.

A delayed copy of image trigger is provided by the second generator signal flash. It's purpose is mainly the control of external flashes.

The third generator line trigger is used by the applet as internal timer for all trigger signals. The signal is required by some cameras for the common synchronization of various cameras.

Finally the fourth signal is a periodical clock of 55MHz. Some cameras can be run by an external clock signal.

You can attach each CC signal to each one of the four generators or a constant low or high level. In many cases the camera trigger signal is attached to CC0.

The menu section Digital I/O displays the status of the four input signals. Additionally you can set the level of the two digital outputs.

A detailed description of the trigger system is found in the document microEnable IV trigger system.

Please read the according chapter of the manual of your camera, which output format is used.


Parameters
.

Digital Output

The digital output can be entered. The four values 0 to 3 are possible because of two output channels for each port.

Digital Input

The digital input can't be entered. This sub entry is only an information field with possible values of 0 and 1 for each port.
